TopicTitle: Heavily modded 64 bit crashes not too long after loading screen.

Articles.Content:
32 bit wouldn't even get passed the loading screen, so that's out of the question. I have a lot of mods right now, so I somewhat expected problems. I'm not new to modding, so I usually find a solution with the aid of Google. I couldn't find anything to save me. I am getting a memory access violation. I don't understand why this is happening, I have 16 gb RAM. I am using aggressive active texture management for 64 bit. Here are my specs [TABLE=class: section, width: 643]

I will also provide a crash report and logs if someone is willing to help.
Crash logs would be great. I'll need to look at both your KSP.log and your Output_log.txt.

The windows 64bit build sometimes crashes at less than 4Gb of memory used. Don't ask why, it just happens. Really it's unpredictible. You might want to try an external boot of Linux. You have a good machine, might be worth trying it out.

Else yes, we'd need an output_log.txt to say anything conclusive.

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/r1bt0r5o8lj0j99/AAAxEhYyyMKVQqB4Lg-WLFZKa?dl=0

That is the ksp.log and output_log

Edited December 20, 2014 by s10w10rr1s
spelling

Alright, from the looks of it, your Firespitter is outdated (I've heard there is a working version on Snjo's Github), KineTechAnimation.dll is throwing massive errors while loading, EVE is throwing a lot of nullrefs which are telling me it's not updated to 0.90 yet, and TAC seems to be what crashed.

Are you sure that ou are using updated versions to 0.90 for all those mods?

i have never had a problem with outdated mods. they usually work on new versions. that laziness finally came back to bite me in the rear. i will update the ones that need updating and see what happens. thank you for the help!

It's better to never assume they do, most mods lock themselves on specific versions of the game. Especially for this update, a lot of plugins broke, was even the first time RealChute really broke. Dig up and try to see if your mods have updated versions. This thread can also help you.
